free_text.Learning outcomes: This course aims at providing the advanced tools for the theoretical description of quantum many-body systems, both at zero- and finite temperature. The focus of the course is the derivation of the perturbation expansion of one- and two-body Green's functions in terms of Feynman diagrams. For finite temperature, the Matsubara formalism is introduced. As examples, the theories of the Fermi-liquid and of a weakly-interacting Bose gas above Tc, are developed. For a quantum degenerate Bose gas, the symmetry-breaking assumption and the resulting Dyson-Belaev perturbation formalism are developed. As an application, the Bogolyubov and Popov approximations for BEC are developed and superfluidity is discussed. [br/][br/]
free_text.Content: [b]1.	Introduction[/b][br/]- General considerations on quantum many-body systems[br/]- Reminder: second quantization, field operators.[br/]- Reminder: Schrödinger, Heisenberg and interaction representations[br/]- Reminder: statistical mechanics and thermodynamics of ideal Fermi and Bose gases.[br/][b]2.	Perturbation theory of quantum many-body systems at T=0[/b][br/]- Green's functions: definition and general properties[br/]- Gell-Mann and Low theorem, Wick theorem[br/]- Perturbation expansion and Feynman diagrams. Feynman rules in real and reciprocal space.[br/]- Self-energy and the Dyson equation[br/]- Example: the weakly interacting Fermi gas: The Fermi liquid[br/][b]3.	Perturbation theory of quantum many-body systems at T>0[/b][br/]- Green's function at finite temperature and imaginary time representation[br/]- Periodicity of the Green's function and expansion in Matsubara frequencies[br/]- Perturbation expansion and Feynman diagrams. Feynman rules in real and reciprocal space.[br/]- Example: The weakly interacting Bose gas above Tc.[br/]- Example: Bose-Einstein condensation and superfluidity[br/][b]4.	Symmetry-breaking formalism for a quantum degenerate Bose gas[/b][br/]- Bose-Einstein condensation. [br/]- The symmetry-breaking assumption and the Dyson-Belaev formalism[br/]- Feynman rules for the Dyson-Belaev formalism[br/]- Example: Bogolyubov and Popov approximations for BEC. Superfluidity.[br/][br/][br/][br/]

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Ce cours vise à fournir les outils avancés pour la description théorique des systèmes quantiques à plusieurs corps, à la fois à température zéro et finie. On dérivera la théorie de perturbation pour les fonctions de Green à un et à deux corps, à l'aide des diagrammes de Feynman. Pour le cas à température finie, on introduira le formalisme de Matsubara. La théorie du liquide de Fermi et celle du gaz de Bose au-dessus de Tc seront développées à titre d'exemples. Ensuite, on introduira l'hypothèse de rupture de symétrie, nécessaire pour décrire le gaz de Bose dégénéré, et on développera le formalisme de Dyson-Belaev qui s'ensuit. Comme exemples, les approximations de Bogolyubov et de Popov pour la BEC seront développées et la superfluidité sera discuté.
